struct  Vps_CaptCreateParams

Detailed Description

This modules define APIs to capture video data using video ports in VPS. This module can be used for single channel capture as well as multi-channel capture.

Capture driver supports the following FVID2 APIs (see also FVID2 API)

  • Creating the driver - Fvid2_create()
    Parameter Value
    drvId FVID2_VPS_CAPT_VID_DRV
    instanceId In case of VIP, instance ID is generated by calling below macro with proper VIP, slice and port ID.
    VPS_CAPT_VIP_MAKE_INST_ID
     or the global capture handle.
    VPS_CAPT_INST_ALL
    createArgs Vps_CaptCreateParams *
    createStatusArgs Vps_CaptCreateStatus *
    cbParams

    Fvid2_CbParams *

    When Fvid2_CbParams.cbFxn is set, Fvid2_CbParams.cbFxn gets called based on value of Vps_CaptCreateParams.periodicCbEnable

    Fvid2_Handle returned by Fvid2_create() is used in subsequent FVID2 APIs
  • Deleting the driver - Fvid2_delete()
    Parameter Value
    handle Capture driver handle
    deleteArgs NOT USED, set to NULL
  • Starting the driver - Fvid2_start()
    Parameter Value
    handle Capture driver handle
    cmdArgs NOT USED, set to NULL

  • Stopping the driver - Fvid2_stop()

    Parameter Value
    handle Capture driver handle
    cmdArgs NOT USED, set to NULL
    • Controlling the driver - Fvid2_control()
      See VPS Capture IOCTL's for the list of IOCTLs supported by the driver.
    • Getting captured frames from the driver - Fvid2_dequeue()
      Parameter Value
      handle Capture driver handle
      frameList [OUT] Fvid2_FrameList.numFrames returns the number of captured frames returned in this Fvid2_dequeue() invocation.
      [OUT] Fvid2_FrameList.frames[0..Fvid2_FrameList.numFrames-1] are the captured Fvid2_Frame pointers to the captured frames.
      [OUT] For each Fvid2_Frame, Fvid2_Frame.perFrameCfg points to Vps_CaptRtParams that was set during Fvid2_queue() This structure gets filled with the captured width and height information. When sub-frame mode is enabled this structure is filled for every sub-frame. The parameter capturedOutHeight shall be invalid for the first field/frame. From the second field/frame onwards this value shall hold the captured height of the previous field/frame. For the last sub-frame in the EOF ISR the parameter numOutLines is updated with the capturedHeight.
      [OUT] FID for every field/frame is filled when Fvid2_dequeue() is called. When sub-frame mode is enabled the FID is filled after the first sub-frame is captured. For the first field/frame this value shall be invalid.
      streamId Value can be from 0 .. Vps_CaptCreateParams.numStream-1
      timeout Must be BIOS_NO_WAIT
    • Releasing used frames back to the driver - Fvid2_queue()
      Also used to queue initial frame buffers to the driver, before calling Fvid2_start().
      Parameter Value
      handle Capture driver handle
      frameList [IN] Fvid2_FrameList.numFrames sets the number of captured frames given back to driver in this Fvid2_queue() invocation.
      [IN] Fvid2_FrameList.frames[0..Fvid2_FrameList.numFrames-1] are the captured Fvid2_Frame pointers that are being returned.
      [IN] For each Fvid2_Frame, Fvid2_Frame.perFrameCfg points to Vps_CaptRtParams. This structure is filled and returned when Fvid2_dequeue() is called.
      streamId Value can be from 0 .. Vps_CaptCreateParams.numStream-1 OR VPS_CAPT_STREAM_ID_ANY

    Capture driver application flow is as follows

    • Init all required modules by calling respective module init functions
    • Create driver using Fvid2_create()
    • Set driver specific parameters using Fvid2_control()
      In case of VIP capture driver, set the VIP parameters using IOCTL_VPS_CAPT_SET_VIP_PARAMS
    • Prime buffers using Fvid2_queue()
    • Create, configure and start external video decoder or sensor driver
    • Start capture using Fvid2_start()
    • Dequeue captured frame and queue back used frames using Fvid2_dequeue() and Fvid2_queue()
    • Stop capture using Fvid2_stop()
    • Stop and delete external video decoder or sensor driver
    • Delete capture driver using Fvid2_delete()
    • De-Init modules by calling respective module de-init functions

Macro Definition Documentation

#define VPS_CAPT_INST_ISS_CAL_A   (VPS_CAPT_INST_ISS_BASE)

ISS Capture instance. Writes captured CSI2 stream to memory, processing limited to capabilities of CAL sub-module.

Warning
The instance identifier macro could change.
#define VPS_CAPT_INST_ISS_CAL_A_CPI   (VPS_CAPT_INST_ISS_CAL_A + 1U)

Do not use this as instance identifier for CAL Driver.

Warning
The instance identifier macro could change.
#define VPS_CAPT_INST_ISS_CAL_A_OTF   (VPS_CAPT_INST_ISS_CAL_A_CPI + 1U)

Not Supported for now. ISS Capture instance. Writes captured CSI2 streams / from parallel interface to memory. Complete ISP could be used to process captured streams.

Warning
The instance identifier macro could change.
#define VPS_CAPT_SCALER_ID_DEFAULT   (0U)

Scaler ID to be used in the set scaler coefficient and set/get advance scaler params IOCTLS.

Since this driver supports only one scaler per driver instance, the scaler could be identified by the instance handle. The below macro is used for initializing the scaler ID to a default value.

ISS_CHANGE_REQ - Move this to VIP specific header

#define VPS_CAPT_STREAM_ID_ANY   (FVID2_STREAM_ID_ANY)

Value to use for 'streamId' when required to do Fvid2_queue to any stream.

Note, this value cannot be used as 'streamId' with Fvid2_dequeue

#define VPS_CAPT_STREAM_ID_MAX   (8U)

Maximum stream's that can be captured per channel.

Stream's corresponds to different types of output that are possible for a given capture input source.

The stream output type is setup by user during Fvid2_create()

Example streams are,

For a 1080P input source, Stream 0: YUV420 non-scaled output Stream 1: YUV422 scaled output Stream 2: RAW VBI output

In case of ISS on-the-fly capture, we could possibly have output from ReSizer A, ReSizer B, H3A stat (x2), CAL writes (upto 6), etc... In current usecase scenarios, we could have upto 6 streams at a time.

Refer to user guide for more details about what valid stream combinations are possible.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum Vps_CaptBufferCaptMode

Buffer capture mode. These modes depends on the underlying hardware. Not all capture interfaces can support all mode. Please refer interface specific header for expections.

Enumerator
VPS_CAPT_BCM_FRM_DROP 

In this mode the driver will stop capturing data when there are no more buffers at the input queue. The driver will not hold any buffer with it and the last buffer will be returned to the application through dequeue call. For this mode, the driver makes use of the VPDMA drop data feature.

VPS_CAPT_BCM_LAST_FRM_REPEAT 

In this mode the driver will keep capturing the data to the last queued buffer when there are no more buffers at the input queue. The driver will hold the last buffer with it till the application queues any new buffer or the capture is stopped.

VPS_CAPT_BCM_CIRCULAR_FRM_REPEAT 

In this mode the driver will keep reusing all the sets of buffer with it in a circular fashion. Application cannot get back any buffer from the driver when streaming is on and dequeue call will result in error.

VPS_CAPT_BCM_MAX 

Should be the last value of this enumeration. Will be used by driver for validating the input parameters.

Function Documentation

static UInt32 Vps_captGetChId ( UInt32  chNum)
inlinestatic

Get capture channel ID from channel number.

chNum is value which is a combination of

  • instance ID
  • stream ID for that instance
  • channel ID for that stream, instance

For details refer to video capture section in User Guide.

Parameters
chNum[IN] Channel number
Returns
Channel ID (0 .. VPS_CAPT_CH_PER_PORT_MAX - 1)

  • stream ID for that instance
  • channel ID for that stream, instance

Parameters

Returns
instance ID (0 .. VPS_CAPT_INST_MAX - 1)

static UInt32 Vps_captMakeChNum ( UInt32  instId,
UInt32  streamId,
UInt32  chId 
)
inlinestatic

Make a system unique channel number.

chNum is value which is a combination of

  • instance ID
  • stream ID for that instance
  • channel ID for that stream, instance

For details refer to video capture section in User Guide.

Parameters
instId[IN] Instance ID.
streamId[IN] Stream ID.
chId[IN] Channel ID within an instance.
Returns
Channel number
